abstract: So what kind of financial leader is Kenneth D. Lewis, Bank of America’s chief executive? The billionaire Warren E. Buffett thinks he is an “ironic hero” who “inadvertently saved” the financial system by hastily moving to buy Merrill Lynch at almost any price.
snippet: So what kind of financial leader is Kenneth D. Lewis, Bank of America’s chief executive? The billionaire Warren E. Buffett thinks he is an “ironic hero” who “inadvertently saved” the financial system by hastily moving to buy Merrill Lynch at almos...
lead_paragraph: So what kind of financial leader is Kenneth D. Lewis, Bank of America‘s chief executive? The billionaire Warren E. Buffett thinks he is an “ironic hero” who “inadvertently saved” the financial system during last fall’s economic crisis by hastily moving to buy Merrill Lynch at almost any price.

headline.main: Lewis Gets Faint Praise From Buffett
